title: Nubians
summary: Nubians (/ˈnuːbiənz, ˈnjuː-/) (Nobiin: Nobī)[6] are an ethno-linguistic group of people who are indigenous to the region which is now present-day northern Sudan and southern Egypt. They originate from the early inhabitants of the central Nile valley, believed to be one of the earliest cradles of civilization.[7] They speak Nubian languages, part of the Northern Eastern Sudanic languages.
